intro: Alepidea angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved kowhai, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its slender, trifoliate leaves and yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, often in sandy or gravelly soils. Alepidea angustifolia is a deciduous shrub that can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Its flowers attract native pollinators, contributing to the ecological balance of its habitat.
